intro: Securinega grisea, commonly known as the gray securinega, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. The leaves are usually opposite and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
